item.title: vlogbrothers: 'Your Illness is Not Your Fault'
item.description:
I was surprised how intense this script came out. Apparently this is something that's been stewing in me for a long time. I didn't realize it until I got really annoyed at a friend for saying something that I should have seen as thoughtful and kind. It's funny how these things can sneak up inside of you.

Since I didn't actually check in on my health in this video, and I'm sure people will be curious, I do feel better. My sinus headache is persistent, but the cough is chilling out finally (which is good because I separated some connective tissue from my left lower rib, which is making the coughing hurt pretty bad.)

The colitis is under control after an alarming Dayquil-related symptom spike. My medicine is working very well for me, even if it makes my immune system less good at its job.

Thanks for your support of me, but more for supporting the people in your lives who need it more than I do. I have more support than any one human deserves :-)

----

Subscribe to our newsletter! http://nerdfighteria.com/newsletter/

And join the community at http://nerdfighteria.com http://effyeahnerdfighters.com

Help transcribe videos - http://nerdfighteria.info

Hank's twitter - http://twitter.com/hankgreen

item.title: LiKe BuTTeR: 'Best PvP DPS Build in 1.3! FireCrest/BLIND (The Division)'
item.description:
This build has hands down performed the best of everything I have tried since 1.3 came out. The reason it does so well is because you can put out huge bursts of damage without any long pauses in between. This game is all about surviving through heals and resistances. This build will have you melting players before they can recover. I hope you all enjoy! Be sure to drop the video a LIKE if you did!

Note, that if you are doing underground or something else, you might want to throw a g36 in, instead of the MP7 since it performs poorly against strong npcs.

All Division Videos! https://www.youtube.com/playlist?list=PLl-FzMIyKe0XzCcBgkxTtQuUWhZYlF2SV

CONNECT WITH ME!

LIVESTREAM: http://www.twitch.tv/likebutterlive

Twitter: https://twitter.com/#!/LiKeBuTTeR9

Facebook: https://www.facebook.com/likebutter9

Instagram: https://www.instagram.com/likebutter9

item.title: Serge Ramelli: 'Amazing Trick to Add Some Long Exposure to the Sky'
item.description:
To get my source files, sign up at: http://bit.ly/source-files-267

In this episode, I will show you how to add some long exposure sky to your long exposure photo.

1. If you want to see how to shoot super long exposure, check out this video: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=ouW0cdgMEAQ

2. Once you have retouched your photos as per the video, you go to Photoshop and add a sky layer, if you need some sky textures I have included one in the free source files link above. You must be logged in to download.

or you can purchase my full sky collection and get 50% off using the :

http://www.photoserge.com/tutorial/textures_skies?yid=PLP267

Discount Code: 50SKY

3. Put the layer into Multiply mode.

4. Use the Filter - Blur gallery - Path Blur.

Play around with this to give your wind some direction and add some speed, make it faster if you have a super long exposure.

If you want to see how I did the super long exposure panorama of the Walt Disney Concert hall click here:

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=MT8qa-tRpTE

Here is a link to the Landscape master class with the discount code:

http://www.photoserge.com/tutorial/landscape_masterclass?yid=PLP267

Discount Code: LSMC60

Get a BIG discount on Adobe Software here:

http://www.photoserge.com/my-gear?yid=PLP267#divCreativeCloud

Get my entire training at : http://photoserge.com/tutorials/

item.description:

Wassup....I'm Amber and I'm a Weirdo! I make videos that range from challenges, comedy skits, motivational videos, fashion, vlogging my everyday life, LGBT topics, and more. I'm comfortable with who I am, and I'm not afraid to be open to the world. I first started my channel to help others that may be struggling with their identity, to break stereotypes, as well as to showcase my unique androgynous/tomboy style.

Since I started, it's turned into so much more....and I truly LUV and appreciate my followers and supporters. Welcome to the AmbersClosetArmy!

item.title: Giovanni Montalvo: 'Memories Away From Home'
item.description:
Memories made in Norway & Mexico City. May-June 2016

Music:

Home

The Drive/Summer Waltz

by Dustin O'Halloran

Snapchat: gio.brahh

Instagram: https://instagram.com/giobrahh/

Email: giobrahh@gmail.com

F.A.Q

What camera do you use?

Panasonic GH4, although if you like the footage I'm filming I owe it more to the lenses I use, invest in good lenses, not an expensive camera.

Please don't think that my videos are great because of my camera. The camera you use is only a tool. I could use other cameras and still tell a good story, different cameras enable different possibilities, not a better video or story.

The footage does not look like it does in the finished movie straight out of the camera. I go through a process called Color Grading.

What lenses do you use?

I primarily use a Voigtlander 25mm F/0.95, Nikon 50mm F/2.8 Macro, and a SLR Magic 12mm F/1.6 (My camera has a crop factor of 2X so 25mm=50mm etc..) These are all manual focus on my camera, auto focus is never used when making movies you see in the cinema. Also, I don't really like zoom lenses, I like primes that have a look to them.

How do you stabilize your footage?

Cheap Tripod, Cheap Monopod, Glidecam HD4000

How did you get all this equipment?

I get paid to make videos for people, I've purchased most of my equipment with my money. I started with just a camera, focused on getting good enough that people wanted to pay me for my work and then purchased better gear. Become good enough at what you want to do that people will want to pay you to do it.

What do you edit and color grade with?

I edit with Adobe Premiere (30% of the time) and Final Cut Pro X (70% of the time). I use Color Finale within FCP sometimes along with Impulz and Osiris LUTS. I could edit what I edit in iMovie or Premiere or Vegas, it's not the Editing Software, it's the Editor.

How long does it take you to edit?

Not very long, well most videos I can edit within 4-6 hours, anything more than that and it's mostly minor details and polishing that I just take my time with. Depending on the project it can take days or weeks though. (Editing is my jam)

How do you come up with your ideas?

Well I have a bunch of ideas written in my Notes app on my phone that just come to me, sometimes I'll just get an idea and I'll be like "yes!" and I'll just execute that idea as soon as I have it, I don't like dwelling on ideas that I can execute with what I have at that moment.

How old are you?

18

Where did you learn filmmaking?

Nowhere, taught it to myself from the internet and practice, lots and lots of practice. No one at all has ever taught me filmmaking.I started filmmaking in April or May of 2015 (can't remember well) if that's any help showing how much practice can help you improve!

Do you go to film school?

No. I'm going to film school in London in October! Film school can teach you the process of making films, but it can't teach you how to tell a good story or be creative. You have to do that yourself and I like to think that you can see that in action on my channel. I don't need someone to give me something to make as homework in order to make a film, I just go out and create, and get better and better because I practice constantly. You won't become a great filmmaker because of film school, you'll become a great filmmaker because you dreamed of, worked for and went out and made great films. (I don't know if you can tell but I really believe film school is not necessary, beneficial yes. But it's how much you put into it.)

Where do you live?

Texas (Want to get out of here though) Moving to London in October/September

Have another question?

Just ask me in the comments or email me or message me on social media, I try to respond to everyone :)

Am I awesome?

Yes, yes you are.

If you read all this let me know in the comments :)
